item.title: Deploying OVA/OVF to remote vCenter using OVFTool
item.description: I had recently come across the need to deploy an OVA file remotely and didn’t want to have to upload the file over VPN to the destination vCenter, the solution is to install OVFTool ↗ on a server that has local access to the vCenter and deploy it using the following syntax: ovftool.exe --acceptAllEulas -ds="[DATASTORE NAME HERE]" --net:"NAME OF OVA NETWORK"="NAME OF PORT GROUP" --prop:[PROPNAME]=[Value] \path\to\appliance.ova vi://vcsa.domain.com/DatacenterName/host/ClusterName The easiest way to get a list of objects you must reference for --net and --prop values is by running (in this example I am testing a vSphere Data Protection 5.
